snippet: The Civil Rights Division contended that the rule would disproportionately suppress turnout among eligible Hispanic voters.
abstract: Justice Department’s civil rights division blocks Texas from enforcing a law requiring voters to present photo identification at the polls, contending that the law would disproportionately suppress turnout among eligible Hispanic voters.
lead_paragraph: The Civil Rights Division contended that the rule would disproportionately suppress turnout among eligible Hispanic voters.

headline.seo: Justice Dept. Blocks Texas Law on Photo ID for Voting
headline.main: Justice Dept. Blocks Texas on Photo ID for Voting
headline.print_headline: Justice Dept. Blocks Texas On Photo ID for Voting
